3. How We Use and Share Information
Summary

THIS PRIVACY POLICY CONTAINS SIX SECTIONS:

How We Use and Share Information
We may collect information using "cookies."
We use this information to help operate our Website more efficiently, to gather broad demographic information and to monitor the level of activity on our Website.
We use this information to help operate our Website more efficiently, to gather broad demographic information and to monitor the level of activity on our Website.

These companies may collect and use click stream information, browser type, time and date, subject of advertisements clicked or scrolled over during your visits to our Website and other websites in order to provide advertisements about goods and services likely to be of interest to you.
We may use other companies to serve third-party advertisements when you visit and use our Website.

As is true of most web sites, we gather certain information automatically and store it in log files.
This information may include internet protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, internet service provider (ISP), referring/exit pages, operating system, date/time stamp, and/or clickstream data.

As is true of most web sites, we gather certain information automatically and store it in log files.
This information may include internet protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, internet service provider (ISP), referring/exit pages, operating system, date/time stamp, and/or clickstream data.

We may also use pixel tags (which are also known as web beacons and clear GIFs) on our Website to track the actions of users on our Website.
We may use both session cookies (which expire once you close your web browser) and persistent cookies (which stay on your computer or mobile device until you delete them) to provide you with a more personal and interactive experience on our Website.
We use two broad categories of cookies: (1) first party cookies, served directly by us to your computer or mobile device, which are used only by us to recognize your computer or mobile device when it revisits our Website; and (2) third party cookies, which are served by service providers on our Website, and can be used by such service providers to recognize your computer or mobile device when it visits other websites.
